#summary Embed Mono(.NET) in your Java applications in 5 minutes, download included

= Introduction =

[http://mono-project.com/What_is_Mono Mono is a multi-platform CLR/.NET implementation] written and maintained by Novell.

It makes it possible to run .NET programs on Linux, MacOS X and other unices.

A very cool feature of Mono is its Embedding C API, which is an ideal target for use from Java using [http://jnaerator.googlecode.com/ JNAerated] wrappers.

= Downloads =

Preliminary binary download : [http://nativelibs4java.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/Mono.jar Mono.jar] (contains Java sources, their compiled classes and the JNAerator runtime - including JNA).

= Building =

First, checkout Mono's project file from nativelibs4java :
{{{
svn checkout http://nativelibs4java.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/ Mono
}}}

Go to the `Mono` directory and download JNAerator :
{{{
wget http://ochafik.free.fr/Java/jnaerator.jar
}}}

Then launch JNAerator :
{{{
java -jar jnaerator.jar Mono.jnaerator
}}}

You'll get a neat [http://nativelibs4java.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/libraries/Mono/Mono.jar Mono.jar library wrapper such as this one].
